instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5_REG: What is PP3V3_S5_REG? PP3V3_S5_REG is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: Been trouble shooting one wire... <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> pin 5 no voltage and <CAPACITOR>C6908</CAPACITOR> no voltage tested for short and says OL. Maybe this was dumb i tryed jumping from <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR> str8 to pin 5 on <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> still no green light. but should i have jumped this ?

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: Green light by jumping <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR> to <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> pin 5 did it again and it worked maybe wasnt soldered right...  Still no fan spin nothhing hot

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> has traca dmg coming from 16v pin ran jumper from <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> pin 5 to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> f7040 now gets 12vs

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: still no power sensed a rabbit hole for a cheap board...

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: Do you gave <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL>???? If yes short <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR> pads to power on board..... Core 2 duo boards does not power on by itself..

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: The fan spins it powers on I didn't know we had to short this model thankyou..!!

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: not solved yet thou fans are spinning loudly ill keep you posted thx aprendiz

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message:
Ok so i plugged in the board into the chassis.... and it started smoking..... no apple logo no chime just white screen. i dont think i was supposed to jump this """"7085 has traca dmg coming from 16v pin ran jumper from <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> pin 5 to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> f7040 now gets 12vs"""" 

I checked <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG</SIGNAL> i get .900volts so i think its time to troubleshoot that circuit

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: I undid the jumper wire from <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: Ok this is weird.... <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> i get 5v on one side and 1v on the other..... ?

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: ok <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> pin 4 gives me ol.. measured on both sides of <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> get 6v on pin 1 0v on pin 2.  <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> gives me OL on pin 1 .500 on pin 2 diode mode... i replaced r7086same result

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message:
No Title

Ran 2 36 Awg wires from <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>. and its working fine now... What is the amerage between these 2 points ? Are these 2 wires safe or should i add more i dont have a thicker variation. Anyways mark as solved for now thanks aprendiz for the pads tip didnt know.

threads.title: 820 2879 No Green light... (WATER DMG)
threads.message: That is a bit thin if it carries the main bus current.
